snippet: As we rebuild after Hurricane Sandy, let’s reduce our dependence on the grid.
abstract: Op-Ed article by David Crane, president of energy company NRG, and Robert F Kennedy Jr, attorney for Natural Resources Defense Council, contends that solar panels could make homes and businesses less dependent on power grid, which, in wake of Hurricane Sandy, has been shown to be unreliable; calls on federal and state governments to push for incorporation of solar power and other clean energy technologies in rebuilding efforts.

byline.original: By DAVID CRANE and ROBERT F. KENNEDY Jr

lead_paragraph: As we rebuild after Hurricane Sandy, let’s reduce our dependence on the grid.
